They bear fruit of the size of filberts‚ and in these are seeds like the pips of pears. When the seed is white the plant is called by some arsen,d by others morion, and by others hippophlomos. The diggers avoid facing the wind, first trace round the plant three circles with a sword, and then do their dig- ging while facing the west. The juice can also be ob- tained from the fruit, from the stem, after cutting off the top, and from the root, which is opened by pricks or boiled down to a decoction.
